title: Polystick
summary: In recreational mathematics, a polystick (or polyedge) is a polyform with a line segment (a 'stick') as the basic shape.  A polystick is a connected set of segments in a regular grid.  A square polystick is a connected subset of a regular square grid.    A triangular polystick is a connected subset of a regular triangular grid.  Polysticks are classified according to how many line segments they contain.[1]
